website_summaries.verdict: Instant drama equates to instant fun with this 10-lbs. bag of 1/2" glass pieces, built for impact and durability.
pros: The stunning look is not secondary to this product's ability to withstand high heat and for the duration as well
Highly reflective while being highly efficient
cons: While most products arrive as advertised, breakage may occur

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but NOT SAFE
customer_reviews.text: Product looks (close) to what is advertised, however, they do turn charcoal black once they come in contact with heat and fire. ****WARNING**** .... the rocks crack and pop out of the firepit! I have been burned by these rocks! See pictures. I even was sure to place the rocks out of direct line of the fire ring but they are still cracking and popping. I REQUESTED FULL REFUND !!!
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: They break up bad
customer_reviews.text: Added these to the round rocks that came with our table. These broke way too fast. My pic is a comparison of what came with the table (round) that actually broke compared to this product. I’m super disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: NTX Mom

customer_reviews.title: 1 small explosion.
customer_reviews.text: Decent purchase. Liked the color and that they were partially reflective. Bought 3 bags at 10lbs each for my fire pit. So far had one glass piece explode. Not sure if it had an air bubble or temperature change, but just glad no one was hit by chucks of glass. Would return if it was multiple pieces but I can understand 1 defective piece.
customer_reviews.author: Jrod The Gr8

customer_reviews.title: Beware....they will crack and break apart
customer_reviews.text: Terribly disappointed. They look great but after a few fires, many of them started cracking and breaking apart. Not performing as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Reiner

customer_reviews.title: Look good but a lot of them crack and break open.
customer_reviews.text: They look good, reflect the flames to give a fuller look to the fire pit. The bad - they crack and brake open in normal use. I have had them for 2 summers now and probably 60-70% have cracked and broken open leaving some sharp edges. It happens throughout usage often with a small click sound but sometimes with a loud bang. I would expect these to have been made of a material that is no so fragile to heat.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Davies

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and safe to handle
customer_reviews.text: I love the look - I prefer these diamonds from crushed glass because I don’t have to worry about them getting into the propane line. They look pretty yet safer to handle. For a small fire pit, a 10-LB bag is not enough - need at least 20 LB. I decided not to use the lava rock that the fire pit came with and I’m glad I did because it looks cleaner with the diamond glass stones alone. I got the emerald green and it is a vivid shade that matched my curtains and cushions - love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amzgrz

customer_reviews.title: Replacement fire glass
customer_reviews.text: I have an indoor propane heater that uses fire glass. A copper colored fire glass container was sent with the heater and the installer put it in before I could stop him. I used the copper glass last year but never liked the looks of it so ordered the blue for this year. Very glad I did. The fire glass is fairly priced and looks great, matching my color scheme better than the copper. I would definitely order this again when I want another color change.
customer_reviews.author: Denise E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ambience
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in June 2017 so it's two years old. We burn on a 50,000 BTU propane gas fire table and have no problems with cracking or smell. We use during summer through fall a few times per month. We really enjoy the color and look of this as opposed to the lava rock that came with the table. We put the 10 lb glass diamonds on top of the lava rock so there is full coverage with no lava rock showing. Maybe having the lava rock on the bottom helps avoid the cracking that many of the reviewers comment about. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Stanbroil Fire Pit glass diamond- Caribbean Blue Luster
customer_reviews.text: These are the slickest fire pit glass rocks that I've ever put in my gas fire pit. All these rocks closer to 1" in size. In addition to these my fire pit contains around 20 large clear crystals that are about 3" in irregular size and along with a 10lb bag of 1/2' cobalt blue cashew type glass rocks. When the fire is lit these rocks give an illusion of the glass melting. Really nice appearance with or without a fire going.
customer_reviews.author: Brod Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Loved the look of the Glass Diamonds in my fire pit. Purchased 20lb and it was enough to fill my fire pit and a small table top unit. The bonus is the glass heats up more than the lava rocks so they both give more heat than they did before. As a note the glass also stays hot longer so you need to be aware of that when trying to cover after shutting off the gas.
customer_reviews.author: DanB

customer_reviews.title: Glass can explode
customer_reviews.text: The rocks explode when heated, it's not tempered glass, like they claim. This is so insane that I can only assume the company is paying for false reviews. Other than that, it's not "Caribbean blue" like they claim, on the color selector it shows Caribbean blue, but after you select it the true color pops up as the image. I hope it was a lighting issue, but it's a shade darker than the other Caribbean blue stones I've bought, I don't feel like mailing back several hundred pounds of stone so I'll just mix it all up
